 "Research and Innovation in a Rapidly Changing World" is the central theme of this year’s conference. 

 Description 

Dear All,

From March 19-22, 2025
, the Marie Curie Alumni Association (MCAA) is organizing the 
Marie Curie Annual Conference and General Assembly 2025
.

For the first time, the conference 
will take place in Poland, in Kraków, with AGH University of Science and Technology as a co-organizer and host
. The event is held under the honorary patronage of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education.

The Marie Curie Alumni Association is an international organization with over 22,000 members from 150 countries, including researchers, experts, industry representatives, and policymakers.

The MCAA Annual Conference & General Assembly is the most important event in the association’s calendar. It gathers approximately 400 participants, both in-person and online, each year. The conference serves as a platform for discussions on key challenges in science and innovation and provides an opportunity to connect with leading experts and research leaders.

The conference will be preceded by events and projects 
supported by the European Commission
, including those under 
the Erasmus+ program
.

One of these events is 
PAOLA (The Pandora Box of Whistleblowing in Academia)
, which will take place 
on March 20, 2025
.

The Observatory for Whistleblowing in Academia (PAOLA)
 is a pioneering initiative dedicated to promoting transparency, integrity, and accountability in academic institutions.

PAOLA’s mission is to combat misconduct and unethical practices in the academic environment by systematically collecting and analyzing reports of irregularities, promoting best practices, and fostering a culture in which ethical conduct is the standard.
